cyclone.name: HENRI
cyclone.current_location: about 230 miles SSE of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving generally north, turning north-northwest and aiming toward Long Island and southern New England
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Long Island, NY or southern New England coastline

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Watch Hill RI to Sagamore Beach MA, including Nantucket, Martha’s Vineyard and Block Island
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning south shore Long Island Fire Island Inlet to Montauk, north shore Port Jefferson Harbor to Montauk, and New Haven CT to west of Watch Hill RI; Tropical-storm Warning coastal NY/NJ west of East Rockaway Inlet to Manasquan Inlet including NYC; Storm-surge Warning Mastic Beach NY to Chatham MA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Mid-Atlantic and New England coastline from New Jersey northward to Maine
weather_observation.wind: Periods of strong easterly winds with occasional gusts near tropical-storm force (35–45 mph) Sunday, strongest during the day Sunday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal surge (around 1 ft or less) possible on the Delaware River and adjacent tidal waters, mainly Sunday high-tide cycles.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain with locally higher amounts Sunday into Monday could cause urban and poor-drainage flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous rip currents along the New Jersey and Delaware beaches may impact harbor/approach operations.
